result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexis R Gonzalez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fourth Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • Fourth Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • Sexual Intercourse with A Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with count 2; with credit for 75 days time served
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count 1; with credit for 75 days time served

miscConds.notes:
*06-23-2022/Judge Mark A. Sanders/Rest. Hearing - Court orders restitution set at ZERO.*
Hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 9:00am
Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample; pay 1 DNA surcharge during probation. Pay all costs and surcharges. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Seek and maintain employment, schooling, or a combination of both at least 40 hours a week.

- Participate in a Sex Offender Evaluation.
- Participate in an age appropriate Relationships Class; as well as an alcohol group.
- Mental Health Assessment and treatment as deemed necessary by the department.

- AODA assessment and treatment as deemed necessary by the department.
- Absolute sobriety.
- Random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexis R Gonzalez

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Annette E Rauch in court.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Restitution hearing.  The court waives the defendants appearance.  The court held a colloquy with the parties. The state confirm no documents  received in regards to restitution.  The court order restitution set at ZERO.

Sentencing proceeded.  Additions and corrections not made.  Statements made by parties.  Additional statements made by J. C.

AS TO COUNT 1: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, concurrent with COUNT 2, with credit for 75 days time served.  

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, concurrent with COUNT 1, with credit for 75 days time served.

AS TO COUNT 3: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction. If revoked, Court allows work release privileges at the discretion of HOC. The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 2 YEARS with the following conditions:

*AODA assessment and treatment as deemed necessary by the department.
*Participate in a sex offender evaluation.
*Participate in an age appropriate relationships class, as well as an alcohol group. 
*Mental health assessment and treatment as deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.
*Seek and maintain employment, schooling, or a combination of both at least 40 hours a week.
*Pay all costs and surcharges.

Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and pay 1 DNA surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Defense requests restitution hearing. All parties are notified that effective June 13, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Mark Sanders, Branch 28, in Room 620 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Alexis R Gonzalez in court with attorney Annette E Rauch.  Defendant Alexis R Gonzalez in custody.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Spanish interpreter: Laura Salcido sworn in for the victim. 
Plea hearing proceeded. State placed offer on the record.

AS TO COUNTS 1 2 AND 3:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

Defendant Alexis R Gonzalez in court with attorney Annette E Rauch.  Defendant Alexis R Gonzalez in custody.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Spanish interpreter: Laura Salcido sworn in for the victim.
Defense counsel waived reading of the Amended Information entry of guilty plea not needed.  Restitution hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Order to view discovery signed and filed

Defendant Alexis R Gonzalez in court with attorney Annette E Rauch.  Defendant Alexis R Gonzalez in custody.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
State compliant with victim notification.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Defense needs offer.  Defense to provide an affidavit as to who Defendant would be living with upon release.  Defense requests a plea date.  
  Plea hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Borowski.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Rothstein, Br. 25.

Defendant Alexis R Gonzalez in court with attorney Annette E Rauch.  Defendant Alexis R Gonzalez in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 25, Judge Rothstein. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Defense request to be heard as to bail. Case is adjourned to Br. 25.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Retainer received and filed.  bm

Adjustment Number: 22A 029497,
Payable Number: 995344,
Receipt Number: 22RP012296,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Alexis R Gonzalez not in court, defendant in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.    If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to remain in custody until a device becomes available.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Court ordered no contact with J.B.; L.S.B.; L. S. B.; J. E. C. R
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

11:07 AM Defendant Alexis R Gonzalez in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Alexis R Gonzalez in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Alexis R Gonzalez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY. Defense requested to be heard on bail. 
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
